content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown document `md` with many lines. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer as a NamedTuple with keys `question` and `answer`. For a section to be valid, it must start at the beginning of the line. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text. Provide example.

You can safely ignore markdown content starting with `# Answer:`. Use the standard library only!

### Examples

```julia-repl
julia> md = [
           "Some markdown",
           "",
           "# Question",
           "## Subheading",
           "Paragraph 1",
           "Paragraph 2",
           "# Answer:",
           "Answer"
         ]
5-element Array{String,1}:
 "Some markdown"
 ""
 "# Question"
 "## Subheading"
 "Paragraph 1"
 
julia> q_and_a_extractor(md)
(question = "Paragraph 1\nParagraph 2", answer = "Answer")
```
